Reviews.Title: Outstanding
Reviews.Author: WMHi
Reviews.Content: Just received this one and I'm using it to leave this message.  It was easy to setup and configure and I must say this Dell Inspiron i7-2670qm 15R is an outstanding notebook for the price.  This machine has excellent performance. It's fast with a great display and keyboard w/number pad and includes features like HDMI, two USB 3.0, and eSATA connectors.  The i7 quad processor ranks about 89 on the highend cpu benchmark scale making this a great value since notebooks like this one can sale for upwards of $1,000.  If you are looking for a good laptop for under $600, this one's outstanding.

Reviews.Title: Awesome if you upgrade the hard drive but...
Reviews.Author: CyberChicken
Reviews.Content: I recently purschased this laptop with the $590 deal and for that price I can tell you it was a great buy. I like to take my time when buying computer components because since I live in México is not as ez as many of you to return an item if it comes dented, scratched or fails on the first days after purschase because at that time I'd probably back from the US (Amazon is the best thing ever I think)...so I was looking for a laptop that fulfills my high requirements since I am a programmer and a gamer to get the best performance for the best price, in this case it will be mainly for programming over gaming, so my first priority was processor because that is something you'll live with the rest of your laptop's life, then the RAM Memory which can be upgradable at anytime, graphics (HDMI port), screen size and the last thing I care about is hdd capacity (just use an external hdd for data).This laptop comes with i7 which means that you are getting 4 cores in contrast to the i5 that are 2 cores and that represents great performance in multitasking and hard processing in long runs even when you get faster frequencies with 2 cores, I recommend you to go to the cpubenchamarks page which can help you to have an overview and ranking performance of the cpu model you are looking for, when buying a laptop be careful of those advertisements deals of some AMD processors that are 3-4 cores that don't perform as Intels i3-i5 because sometimes the Intel performs better even with 2 cores.Now, RAM memory is upgradable to 8 GB and for starting with 6GB is good and you save a bit here to later buy 2x4GB sticks same brand because when I opened it I noticed it came with 2 different brands.So far the other features were good for me except for the hard drive, it is 500GB - 5400rpm which is a speedbump for the processor, so without awaiting to see how the HDD would perform and before I got the laptop I ordered a 128GB SSD (Samsung 830 series because of its reliability and rankings) and I know the big difference it would make. The performance before the SSD was really noticeable as expected after I installed it, the SSD was 2.5x faster that the HDD and now it easily boots in 13 - 16 seconds average, consider here that I installed a fresh instance of Windows 7 x64 Ultimate so no preinstalled Dell software that could slow down my boot time. The really bad news here are that if you want to upgrade the HDD for a SSD you'll need to literally dismantle your laptop in order to do that (I was not aware of that until the moment) so I took the risk in its brand new state and it wasn't so hard for me since I am an Engineer in Computer Systems but anyone can do it because it's pretty straightforward, all is just remove screws (during the procedure I highly recommend using antistatic wrist strap). Thanks to some tutorials I found in youtube I was able to do it with no problems but I sweated during the process (j/k) hoping I wouldn't break anything (plastics). At the end I did the system rating test and the graphics were the low ranked that determined the rating which I don't care much since I can run HD Videos, I think it has the Intel HD Graphics 3000 which is the most common, anyways If I want to play video games I just have to seat on my desktop with EVGA GTX 560 TI FTW. Hope you find this useful.

Reviews.Title: Awesome product in very low price
Reviews.Author: Awesome!!!!!!!
Reviews.Content: I have received this laptop with all the configuration as written...It's really worth to have this configuration in such low prize.. Love it

Reviews.Title: CAREFUL PURCHASING DELL
Reviews.Author: European Sales
Reviews.Content: DELL KEEPS ON DOING MACHINES WITH A GOOD RATIO BETWEEN PRICE AND PERFORMANCE...UNFORTUNATELY  MACHINES WITH THIS BRAND STOP WORKING ALL OF A SUDDEN WITHOUT ANY PARTICULAR REASON BUT WITH VERY CRITICAL TROUBLES E.G. HARD DISK FAILURE OR THE LIKE. DELL USES CHEAP COMPONENTS. IT ALREADY HAPPENED TO ME TWICE IN THE LAST 3 YEARS. 2 BRAND NEW LAPTOP, INCLUDING THIS ONE, DEAD WITH NO REASON.

Reviews.Title: Dell Inspiron i15rn-5294bk
Reviews.Author: Bob
Reviews.Content: My technically savy son-in-law told me that this is exactly what a technically ignorant 68 year old needs. It seems to do everything I need it to do and thensome.

Reviews.Title: Great Deal, Great Laptop
Reviews.Author: TheGuyWhoIsDoingAReviewYouAreNowReading
Reviews.Content: I use this laptop for homework and listening to music. The speakers sound great and its a lot faster than my old desktop. This laptop is everything I expected it to be. If you want a something good for a reasonable price I highly recommend buying this.

Reviews.Title: screen broke!
Reviews.Author: B Smith
Reviews.Content: The hinge mechanism on the screen broke a little more than a year after this was purchased.  It broke under normally opening and closing usage by an adult and occasionally two kids.  The kids open it the same way as an adult as far I can tell.  I think it is a poorly constructed mechanism and would not recommend the PC for that for reason.  I expect to get 3 years out of a new PC

Reviews.Title: Excellent value
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought this about a year ago, and it's still running strong; build quality is quite good.  I use mine primarily to run Lightroom and Photoshop, with a bit of Ableton Live.  CPU performance has been very satisfactory. The hard disk isn't the fastest, but what can one expect from a 5400 RPM drive?  I keep my photo library on a USB 3.0 external drive, so it's not too painful.  I'd buy this again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: Has not lived up to the price or description
Reviews.Author: Jack Gahan
Reviews.Content: I have had to call tech support 2 times and they tell me the same thing - I have to pay more for another form of a warranty when all I want is for the built in wireless to work - I fixed the problem myself with a $11 usb wireless card - but Dell still refuses to fix the issue when it is all over their web site that the card they installed is no good...JUST FIX IT OR GIVE ME ONE THAT WORKS

Reviews.Title: One of the best I have ever had
Reviews.Author: Kamen
Reviews.Content: Very nice laptop!!! I have all the features I need. I don't play games, so it if very fast for browsing, MS office , etc. Had a problem with the HDD under the warranty period, and DELL customer service sent a technician to change it at my place with no cost. Greta service, great product! Love it!

Reviews.Title: Best Laptop ever Bought on Amazon.
Reviews.Author: Ferdicon Andy
Reviews.Content: Best Laptop I have ever had, with 8 logical processor you expect speed and it's delivers. 4 cpu(s) is definitely what you will invest your money on. I have used the Laptop for 5 months before making this review and everything WORKS WELL.

Reviews.Title: Excelent Choice.
Reviews.Author: Carlos V. "Carlos"
Reviews.Content: This machine exceeds my hardware expectations for a great price.  I had some problems with the manufacturer registration form, but eventually it was resolved without problems. Five Stars... Buy with confidence.

Reviews.Title: Nice computer
Reviews.Author: SDWilbanks
Reviews.Content: For the price, this is a good computer that is amazingly quick.  Although I have only had it a short period of time, there have been no issues with it.

Reviews.Title: Placement of mouse pad is awkward
Reviews.Author: Terry B
Reviews.Content: Am very pleased with the performance of this unit. But the off center placement of the large surface mouse pad makes it rather awkward to use. I find my palm is inadvertently touching the pad while trying to direct work with my finders and causing stray signals. Sometimes the page zooms in and stops pointer activity. One must keep your hands high above the mouse pad to prevent such interference.Otherwise a very high quality and useful laptop.

Reviews.Title: Not for ENGINEERS who try to WORK on complex softwares
Reviews.Author: Tejeshkumar Bagul
Reviews.Content: I am writing for engineers perticularly. u cant expexct much from this computer. do not go on the i7 processor. it does not mean much. try installing MATLAB, ANSYS, AutoCAD and u will see how pissed u r. try out some other laptop for same cost and better features. for other guys like GAMING a big NO. for general purposes its the best.

Reviews.Title: Value for Money - Better than expected!
Reviews.Author: Nagpal M
Reviews.Content: What I like about it:1.  Quad Core 2nd Gen i7 processor - Speedy2.  4 USB port including 2 USB 3.0, 1 eSata and 1 USB 2.0 - Takes care of most of the needs3.  HDMI port - Connectivity4.  Quick Set-up5.  Value for money at around 600 USD6.  Looks above averageWhat I don't like about it1.  Bit on the heavier side - Around 6 pounds - not the best companiion to travel2.  Battery support at around 2 hours only - :(3.  A bit on the fatter side if you compare it to the new slim models

Reviews.Title: Dell Inspiron i15RN-5294BK 15" -- Nice Laptop
Reviews.Author: San
Reviews.Content: It is a wonderful model at a very reasonable price from Dell.For the price you kind of get more..

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT PRODUCT
Reviews.Author: Ivell M Bramblett
Reviews.Content: Excwllent computer with lightning fast response time and ample disk storage. It starts up and shuts down quickly. No regrets and no worries.

Reviews.Title: Good laptop and cheap
Reviews.Author: Wesley
Reviews.Content: A laptop that is very good for its price. I bought it only for 590 bucks and its pretty satisfying for its cost. It is i7 so its fast the screen and the keyboard works perfectly good. One thing I like about i7 is that you can do so many things with it, due to its fast processor. DOWNSIDE: The laptop pad of mouse is not very good and is uncomfortable to use so you would need to attach a mouse. Startup time when turning on the computer is also very long but other than that I have no complaints since it is cheap. A good laptop!

Reviews.Title: Hard drive being replaced
Reviews.Author: James L Vargo
Reviews.Content: It was bad from the beginning; just did not want to believe it.  Being replaced tody.  Has been a real slug.

Reviews.Title: Research the Wifi Adapter used.
Reviews.Author: Martinez R
Reviews.Content: I purchased this laptop as I need a new computer immediately.  I've noticed a few problems within the first two weeks.The Good:For the price. Decent processor, RAM, HD size and screen size.Seems well built.  Doesn't have the flimsy plastic feel where I'm afraid to carry it around.  The battery isn't anything to marvel at.  I ran max power settings running virtual machines for small projects.  Two and a half hours so far.  It's light (comparatively to the class of laptop; it's not a Mac Air)Intel Centrino Wireless N 1030 - The onboard wifi/bluetooth card is in serious need of software driver work.  After doing a bit of research I found that I was not the only person with the same wifi problems.  Recently Intel has provided an update (go to Intel website) which fixed most of the problems (i.e. consist disconnections to wifi).  Now I only have problems with connections to 802.11g network connections. 802.11n network connections don't seem to be a problem.Secondly, I spilled a e-cigarette liquid on the keyboard and tried to clean under the keys which were sticky (random keys were sticking). Bad idea. Laptop keyboards may not be meant for easy repair.  Luckily with Amazon Prime I had another keyboard shipped immediately.  Installation of the new keyboard took about 7 easy steps.  So no biggie.If you can get past the 802.11g driver problem this is a good purchase.  Luckily I have 802.11n networks available.Had I not had major problems with the wifi card I'd rate at 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: Just ok
Reviews.Author: C. Gosselin
Reviews.Content: Likes:It's fast for the price point - including fast boot and fast wake-up from sleep.Machine is not pre-loaded with an excessive amount of useless vendor software.15 inch screen is nice.  I'm accustomed to 13.5, so going up to a 15 feels like I'm looking at a movie screen.Dislikes:The plastic case feels very cheap.It's pretty heavy - not a small machine or easy to carry around in a bag.The screen has to be viewed at a very specific angle, otherwise images appear dull.  While this is an issue on all laptops, I have a Dell Latitude that is much more forgiving on viewing angle.Overall:I feel like for the price, I could have found a better PC.  It's ok, but not the best deal on the market right now.

Reviews.Title: Pretty nice PC and better quality
Reviews.Author: Mastercard "Shepherd"
Reviews.Content: When I received this laptop, I pressed the power button right away and straight forward for set up of the WIN 7 OS. It's no huzzle and pretty fast setup.I hav'nt tested the speed yet, but comparing the systems speed of Dell Inspiron i15RN-5294BK with my office desktop Dell Optiflex Core i5-2400 3.1ghz 4GB, 250gb, which is a dual core 2nd gen it looks like that my new Inspiron Core i7-2670QM 2.2Ghz quad core 6GB RAM 500GB the Inspiron is faster than my desktop Optiflex 790.I got 5.8 WPI in my laptop while my Optiflex 790 in the office has only 5.1. I noticed later that WIN7 added Microsoft Signature on the power options and I was wandering how the systems speed appeared compared to power saver then I found an option to enable for High Performance. The system speed dramatically increases and I can compare now that this is more faster than the Dell desktop Core i5-2400 3.1ghz 4GB, 250gb.The Inspiron has Microsoft Essential Security antivirus with antispyware while the one in the office is Microsoft Forefront Client Security. I don't know if this has make a difference in terms of systems speed overall.Pros:I have not thoroughly benchmark the entire system but as far as the CPU Processor is concern, Intel® Core(tm) i7 2670QM was benchmark at ave. CPU mark @ 6780 while the Intel Core i5-2400 3.1ghz 2nd gen. is below at an ave. CPU mark of 6152. Bottom line, the entire system performance are affected based on mobo systems architecture design, graphics card, memory, HDD, etc.The keyboard with numeric pad are smooth to touch and easy to press. The mouse pad is smooth and I feel no hard surface unlike my older inspiron 1525 2.4ghz Core2duo is quite rough surface and need to press hard sometimes annoying.The temperature ave. at the exhaust is warm and the fan is quite.The sound is impressive and I heard the surround when I played the surround video movies. The video HD pictures is quite impressive and clear HD.I will post more later if I found something unusual. But so far it is an impressive piece. After knowing and enable the high performance power options, I can see clearly that this model is superior than the other model having closer range.Cons:1. I don't like the LAN, power, & USB 3.0 ports were located on the rear. I cannot turn the bottoms up 90deg. and lay the display lid on the bed in case I require unlike the HP DV5 pavilion which does not have any port on the rear.2. The socket of the audio out is very tight something not usual when I plug my Creative earphone which was formerly supplied by DELL & IPAD earphone. But the the 3.5mm plug for the creative speakers 2.1ch can easily fit.

Reviews.Title: DELL i7x Laptop on Amazon
Reviews.Author: Niteen
Reviews.Content: DELL i7 at $600 was very attractive...But now I feel, that it is wrong decision...mainly for the Inferrior battery..extra high weight and several software problems..I am unhappy !!
